Package ohos.bundleactive

Class BundleActiveInfosMgr

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.bundleactive.BundleActiveInfosMgr

  • public final class BundleActiveInfosMgr
extends Object
    Provides methods for managing bundle usage statistics, including the methods for querying bundle usage information and state data.

    You can use the methods defined in this class to query the usage history and states of bundles in a specified period. The system stores the query result in a BundleActiveInfos or BundleActiveStates instance and then returns it to you.

    Since:
    4
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.ResourceSchedule#BUNDLE_ACTIVE

      static int BY_OPTIMIZED
      Indicates the interval type that will determine the optimal interval based on the start and end time.
      static int BY_WEEKLY
      Indicates the weekly interval.
      static int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_ALIVE
      Indicates that the application was used recently, is being used, or will be used soon.
      static int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_NEVER
      Indicates that the application has never been used.
      static int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_OFTEN
      Indicates that the application was used in the last few days and may be used in the next few days, but it is not in the active state right now.
      static int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PREFERENCE
      Indicates that the application was used recently and may be used in the next few hours, but it is not in the active state right now.
      static int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PRIVILEGE
      Indicates that the application is in the privileged priority group.
      static int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_SELDOM
      Indicates that the application has not been used in the past few days and is unlikely to be used in the next few days.

      • USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_ALIVE

        public static final int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_ALIVE
        Indicates that the application was used recently, is being used, or will be used soon.

        For an application in this priority group, the system does not restrict its resource usage, including background tasks and alarms.

        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryAppUsagePriorityGroup()

      • USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_NEVER

        public static final int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_NEVER
        Indicates that the application has never been used.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryAppUsagePriorityGroup()

      • USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_OFTEN

        public static final int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_OFTEN
        Indicates that the application was used in the last few days and may be used in the next few days, but it is not in the active state right now.

        For an application in this priority group, the system restricts some of its resource usage. For example, the system may postpone its background tasks and alarms more extensively.

        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryAppUsagePriorityGroup()

      • USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PREFERENCE

        public static final int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PREFERENCE
        Indicates that the application was used recently and may be used in the next few hours, but it is not in the active state right now.

        For an application in this priority group, the system restricts a small amount of its resource usage. For example, the system may postpone its background tasks and alarms.

        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryAppUsagePriorityGroup()

      • USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PRIVILEGE

        public static final int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PRIVILEGE
        Indicates that the application is in the privileged priority group.

        When the application is in the allowlist or for some reason, its privileged priority will not be changed.

        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryAppUsagePriorityGroup()

      • USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_SELDOM

        public static final int USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_SELDOM
        Indicates that the application has not been used in the past few days and is unlikely to be used in the next few days.

        For an application in this priority group, the system restricts most of its resource usage, including the network usage.

        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryAppUsagePriorityGroup()

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static BundleActiveInfosMgr newInstance​(Context context)
        A static factory method used to create a BundleActiveInfosMgr instance based on a specified context.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Returns:
        Returns the BundleActiveInfosMgr instance created if the operation is successful; returns null if the context is null.
        Since:
        4

      • queryBundleActiveInfosByInterval

        public List<BundleActiveInfos> queryBundleActiveInfosByInterval​(int byInterval,
                                                                long begin,
                                                                long end)
        Queries usage information about each bundle within a specified period at a specified interval.

        Permissions: SystemPermission.BUNDLE_ACTIVE_INFO

        Parameters:
        byInterval - Indicates the interval at which the usage statistics are queried. The value can be BY_OPTIMIZED, BY_DAILY, BY_WEEKLY, BY_MONTHLY, or BY_ANNUALLY.
        begin - Indicates the start time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        end - Indicates the end time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of BundleActiveInfos objects containing the usage information about each bundle.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryBundleActiveInfos(long, long)

      • queryBundleActiveInfos

        public Map<String,BundleActiveInfos> queryBundleActiveInfos​(long begin,
                                                            long end)
        Queries usage information about each bundle within a specified period.

        This method queries usage information at the BY_OPTIMIZED interval by default.

        Permissions: SystemPermission.BUNDLE_ACTIVE_INFO

        Parameters:
        begin - Indicates the start time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        end - Indicates the end time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        Returns:
        Returns the map of BundleActiveInfos objects containing the usage information about each bundle. The key value in the Map object indicates the bundle name.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryBundleActiveInfosByInterval(int, long, long)

      • queryBundleActiveStates

        public BundleActiveStates queryBundleActiveStates​(long begin,
                                                  long end)
        Queries state data of all bundles within a specified period identified by the start and end time.

        Permissions: SystemPermission.BUNDLE_ACTIVE_INFO

        Parameters:
        begin - Indicates the start time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        end - Indicates the end time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        Returns:
        Returns the BundleActiveStates object containing the state data of all bundles.
        Since:
        4

      • queryCurrentBundleActiveStates

        public BundleActiveStates queryCurrentBundleActiveStates​(long begin,
                                                         long end)
        Queries state data of the current bundle within a specified period.
        Parameters:
        begin - Indicates the start time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        end - Indicates the end time of the query period, in System.currentTimeMillis() format.
        Returns:
        Returns the BundleActiveStates object containing the state data of the current bundle.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        queryBundleActiveStates(long, long)

      • isIdleState

        public boolean isIdleState​(String bundleName)
        Checks whether the application with a specified bundle name is in the idle state.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application to query.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the application is idle in a particular period; returns false otherwise. The time range of the particular period is defined by the system, which may be hours or days.
        Since:
        4

      • queryAppUsagePriorityGroup

        public int queryAppUsagePriorityGroup​()
        Queries the usage priority group of the calling application.

        The priority defined in a priority group restricts the resource usage of an application, for example, restricting the running of background tasks.

        Returns:
        Returns the usage priority group of the calling application.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PRIVILEGE, USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_ALIVE, USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_PREFERENCE, USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_OFTEN, USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_SELDOM, USAGE_PRIORITY_GROUP_NEVER
